title: pr-au5 COMPLETED
description: Research complete: analyzed 17 proofreading/editing service websites. Documented structural patterns, credibility signals, tone choices, overused tropes, and trust factors. Output committed to docs/research_findings.md and pushed to branch polecat/furiosa-mky5coxr.

title: Build production-ready website
description:
Implement website based on design system and copy:

Technical: Fast, accessible, responsive, clean HTML/CSS, minimal JS
Typography-first rendering, excellent mobile readability
Features: Contact form, clear next steps, no unnecessary tracking

Pages: Home, Services, Process, About, Rates, Contact

Quality: Semantic HTML, CSS custom properties, mobile-first, print stylesheet
Output: Complete website in /site/ directory

title: Research proofreading websites - patterns and credibility
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Study 15-20 high-quality proofreading/editing service websites. Document:
- Common structural patterns (page layouts, navigation)
- Credibility signals (certifications, client lists, process explanations)
- Tone and language choices
- Weaknesses and overused tropes to avoid
- What inspires trust vs undermines it

Output findings to /docs/research_findings.md (proofreading section)

title: Research UX, HCI, and trust psychology
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research and synthesize:
- How users evaluate professional services online
- Trust formation in low-interaction services
- Cognitive load reduction principles
- Readability and scannability best practices
- Accessibility considerations

Translate into concrete, actionable design rules.
Output to /docs/research_findings.md (UX/psychology section)
close_reason: UX research complete: 22 actionable design rules, trust/credibility research, accessibility guidelines

title: Witness Patrol
description: Per-rig worker monitor patrol loop with progressive nudging.

title: Research proofreading websites - tone and differentiation
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Study competitor proofreading websites focusing on:
- How they differentiate themselves
- Pricing presentation strategies
- Service tier structures
- Client communication approaches
- Portfolio/sample presentation
- Contact and inquiry flows

Identify gaps in the market.
Output to /docs/research_findings.md (differentiation section)

title: Design information architecture and user flow
description:
Design clear, minimal site structure:

Pages: Home, Services, Process, About, Rates, Contact
Each page: Clear singular purpose, natural reading order, no redundancy
Navigation: Minimal, clear, no hamburger menus on desktop
User flow: Frictionless from landing to inquiry

Output: IA section of /docs/design_rationale.md

title: Create visual design system
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Design restrained, print-adjacent visual system:

Typography: Primary + secondary fonts, type scale, hierarchy
Color palette: Restrained, print-adjacent, accessible contrast
Spacing: Consistent system, grid logic, white space
Interactions: Subtle hover, focus, active states

Avoid trendy fonts, loud colors, excessive contrast.
Output: /docs/style_guide.md

title: Research publishing industry and award-winning design
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Study:
- Major book publisher websites (Penguin, FSG, Knopf)
- Respected literary journals (Paris Review, Granta)
- Award-winning editorial/typography-focused websites
- Minimal, print-inspired web design

Focus on: restraint, hierarchy, white space, typography-first layouts.
Document patterns that convey seriousness and literary quality.
Output to /docs/research_findings.md (publishing/design section)

title: Write all website copy
description:
Write copy with calm authority, clarity, restraint:

Voice: Professional, humane, serious, precise
AVOID: Marketing clich√©s, exaggerated claims, empty adjectives, fake urgency

Pages to write:
- Home (headline, subhead, key message)
- Services (service descriptions)
- Process (step by step)
- About (background)
- Rates (pricing philosophy)
- Contact (invitation)

Output: /docs/content_copy.md
